attributes.action: Put gynaecological health on the PSHE curriculum for girls aged 11-18
attributes.background: Endometriosis and polycystic ovary syndrome affect millions of girls and women nationwide but there is not any explanation to young women about the symptoms of such illnesses. Education on gynaecological health needs to be put on the curriculum so less women go through their young life in pain.

attributes.action: Make it the law for all schools to display their Anti Bullying Policy!
attributes.background:
A recent study has seen that 80% of teens were not aware their school had an anti-bullying policy. 
100% said they felt it would benefit if the policy was displayed on notice boards around the school. So let’s make it the law to have it displayed and not just on a website!!
attributes.additional_details:
This study was conducted on Chat2HelpAllTeenagers.co.uk from 30 teenagers across the UK. 
Why aren’t schools making all parents and children aware of the policy - as the government website indicates all parents and children should be told about it. 
This recent study highlights that this is not done, and feel we need to change this! 
 
So please help, sign this petition 
 
www.chat2helpallteenagers.co.uk

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Dental Hygiene in pregnancy’ booklets to 12 week antenatal checkups
attributes.background:
I feel like we are being let down in terms of proactive dental hygiene education for pregnant women.
 I believe thousands of women are having to undergo dental work postpartum as they were not aware of the significant affect that changes in hormones during pregnancy can have on their teeth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am aware that the NHS provides free dental care to pregnant women & for up to one year post partum but I feel that more should be done proactively in order to stop new mums having to go through painful/intrusive dental treatment. 

Advice regarding additional brushing after certain foods, not brushing immediately after bouts of morning sickness, additional visits to the hygienist, increasing calcium & vitamin D 

Ensuring that both midwives & dentists educate pregnant women of additional risks

attributes.action: Require UK fashion retailers to sign up to an environmental code of ethics
attributes.background:
Companies trading in the UK should be required to source clothes responsibly.
 
To feed a culture of cheap fashion, companies are ignoring the environmental damage in developing countries.
 
Fashion is the 2nd largest global polluter. The UK is one of the largest consumers of fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC production: Stacey Dooley Investigates Fashion's Dirty Secret. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/5a1a43b5-cbae-4a42-8271-48f53b63bd07

attributes.action: Ban vaping in public places
attributes.background: Not enough is known about vaping and its long-term health effects. The Government shouldn’t allow vaping in public places such as public transport. Let’s protect our children and treat it as a potential health problem of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
This article says that there are potential health issues with vaping and more needs to be learnt. Let’s protect ourselves and future generations now. 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/science/2018/jan/29/vaping-may-raise-cancer-and-heart-disease-risk-study-suggests

attributes.action: Ban TV adverts of  gambling sites and betting firms sponsoring football shirts.
attributes.background:
Gambling addictions are costing the country £1.2bn.
The increasing relationship between football and gambling is normalising gambling  and influencing our vulnerable children and young people. 24/7 access to online betting via smart phones will soon cause a national epidemic. It needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Although not involving a chemical like an addiction to smoking, alcohol or drugs the problem or compulsive gambler is just as much an  addict. They will have financial and relationship problems. They could end up in prison or even committing suicide - suggested rates being 20%.
In 1965 the British Government banned tobacco advertising and in 2005 banned sponsorship of global events.
They need to do the same with gambling and betting firm sponsorships before more lives are ruined.

attributes.action: Introduce a “DADB1” form alongside the “MATB1” form.
attributes.background: The "DADB1" form is for expectant fathers to hand to their employer to kickstart discussions about, and preparation for, Shared Parental Leave (SPL). Researchers have indicated that increasing the numbers of men taking SPL is likely to be a lever in closing the UK’s gender pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
SPL was introduced in the UK April 2015. Around 285,000 qualify for SPL every year yet the take-up could be as low as 2% (source: gov.uk). The Government launched a “Share the joy” campaign in February 2018 to promote SPL and increase the uptake. The impact of this is not yet known.

I believe the "DADB1" form is a simple, pragmatic step towards growing the number of men taking SPL by kickstarting early conversations between expectant fathers and their employers.

attributes.action: Raise the age of sale, of fireworks, to the general public from 18 to 25.
attributes.background: All year round this is an issue but it becomes more apparent in the winter months. Irresponsible youths are allowed to purchase fireworks and they have no regard for the safety of others. Fireworks are meant to be fun but in the wrong hands they soon become weapons.
attributes.additional_details: I have already read so many public posts, by people who have already been affected by youths setting off fireworks in public places, about people whose pets suffer huge distress, let alone non domestic wildlife. If fireworks must be sold to the public it needs to be regulated better.

attributes.action: Urgent Review & Increased Funding of "The 5 Year Forward View for Mental Health"
attributes.background: We urgently need more specialist psychiatric hospitals, walk in clinics, community psychiatrists and nurses.More Day Centres & facilities for people with mental health issues but to get the service back where it should be, we need the funding, and proper funding, to enable this to happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Approx. 15.5M people suffer with a mental health problem in the UK, which is roughly 1 in 4 people. Current plans need reviewing and funding needs injecting urgently. Awareness, Funding & Resources are quickly needed. Waiting times are excessive and lives are being lost as a result of this terrible dilemma we are in. 

Mental Health cases have have increased, which in turn has lead to an increase in our already stretched Emergency Services to deal with problems more frequently. LET'S TALK

attributes.action: Change the The Parliamentary Oath to an oath to the people and to uphold the law
attributes.background:
Change the The Parliamentary Oath to an oath to the people and to uphold the law instead of an oath to the Monarchy
The duty of an hon. Member is to represent their constituents in Parliament
Therefore an hon. Member should be able to make their oath to the people they represent. Not the Monarchy
attributes.additional_details: To recognise that the principal duty of hon. Members is to represent their constituents in Parliament; also recognise that some hon. Members would prefer to swear an oath of allegiance to their constituents and the nation rather than the Monarch; and therefore calls on the Leader of the House to bring forward legislative proposals to introduce an optional alternative Parliamentary oath allowing hon. Members to swear allegiance to their constituents and the nation and to pledge to uphold the law rather than one pledging personal allegiance to the serving Monarch

attributes.action:
Introduce a national day called 
National Ability Day.
attributes.background: People with disabilities are often overlooked, having a National Ability Day will show the country what people with disabilities can do than what we can’t.

attributes.action: Increase firefighters pay!
attributes.background:
My dad is a firefighter and has been amongst the many heroes tackling the fires on the moors/winter hill.
There is such a positive response from the public recognising the gruelling work they do its just a shame their wages don't reflect this with their pay frozen & capped at 1% It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Firefighters pay has been frozen and capped at 1% with inflation rising at around 3%. With their pension and national insurance contributions rising their wages have in effect dropped! 
These heroes risk their lives every day not only putting out fires but doing so much more than you could imagine and they deserve / need to have the cap lifted and their pay increased. Lets give something back to them and help get this changed!

attributes.action: Install ‘donation stations’ at a&e/hospital entrances/exits for people to use
attributes.background:
The NHS provide an amazing service, yet are always getting budget cuts. 

Install machines at hospital entrances and exits in which people can leave a donation if they wish, cash or card (contactless).

Use this to top up the NHS budget as a whole, or let hospitals use how they need to.
attributes.additional_details: Many people leave hospital thinking how can I thank the NHS for their help. I certainly have on our several a&e visits over the last few years. Installing a donation station would help people to feel they are giving thanks whilst helping our NHS through the tough cuts they face. The cost of installing would of course be covered in no time with donations received then start generating profit for the NHS.

attributes.action: Mandatory Autism Awareness training in ALL educational settings
attributes.background: More and more autistic children are loosing out on an education because schools refuse to make reasonable adjustments. We need mandatory Autism Awareness training in ALL educational settings to highlight that small changes can make a huge impact to an individuals education.
attributes.additional_details: Autistic individuals are not difficult or naughty, and they should not be punished with their education at stake when simple adjustments could change the whole educational experience.

attributes.action: Introduce a Licencing system for cyclists and tighten up cycle law.
attributes.background:
Recently a facebook post caused horror and cyclists regularly show little regard for other road users and the law.

Please debate introducing a licence, at least with theory tests similar to other vehicles, which all cyclists must pass and must carry at all times and have 3rd party insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
I once received verbal abuse from a cyclist feeling I was in the wrong. I had dash cam footage reviewed by the police who were horrified how many highway code points the cyclist broke. The cyclist could not be traced so no action was taken but it's typical of the lack of knowledge of cyclists.

I am a horse rider, cyclist, motorcyclist, and car driver. The group I see least consideration for road users and frequent law breaking is cyclists.

attributes.action: Change Government Policy that allows Developers to destroy our Countryside
attributes.background: The current National Planning Framework Policy which dictates the requirements for housing development in the UK means developers have been given the power to force LA's to offer up a minimum of 5 yrs land supply for development putting immense pressure to offer up normally protected Greenbelt
attributes.additional_details: The 5yr land supply makes no allowance for sites that have been given approval but have yet to be developed, ie if the annual requirement for houses in a particular borough, set by government is 1000/yr, the LA must continually find sites to maintain a min. stock of 5000, regardless of whether the developers decide to build or not due to economic or other factors. Developers use this policy to build land stocks while our villages, countryside & greenbelt are being destroyed for profit/greed

attributes.action: Allow working parents free childcare ALL YEAR up to the age of 10.
attributes.background: Working a full time job and having children is hard!  Reagrdless of whether you are single or a couple. The general work place gives 23ish days holiday while children are given 11 weeks,  with no family network to rely on childcare is very costly, almost to the point of it not being worth working.
attributes.additional_details:
You feel guilty if you do work and guilty if you dont! If you want us to work and input into society, help us!
It would be easier to go on benfits and watch my children grow up. 
Help is really needed here! So many people are working just to pay for childcare not to mention how many must be left alone.
Let us have a quality of life with our children.

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Dog to be recognised as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I have mental health problems, anxiety and depression. My dog helps me get out; keeps me calm in town when it's crowded and stops me acting on suicidal thoughts. My dog has given me a reason to get out of bed. Surely this will also help the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: I have also spoken to other people with mental health and found their dogs have been a huge help to them.”

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence to beg or busk with a dog in a public place
attributes.background: Chow dogs are being forced to sit in the heat for over 12 hours as the 'owner' begs for money. Gangs are breeding and importing the dogs for the use of 'entertainment ' to solicit funds. They are 'rented out', forced to urinate tied up, kept in hot vans, beaten and kicked in the head.
attributes.additional_details: Making the use of dogs and other animals for begging and busking a specific offence would make it much easier to bring the perpetrators of this sort of cruelty to justice.

attributes.action: Give an alternate route for couples to reach the spouse visa income requirement
attributes.background:
Each year thousands of couples are kept apart due to the strict and unrealistic financial requirements that must be met in order to obtain a UK spouse visa. 

The current requirement is £18,600 per year, this is not a small amount to earn for one individual as 3rd party income is not considered.
attributes.additional_details: This petition proposes that the financial requirement stays at £18,600, however the UK sponsor must only earn £14,966 per year (full time minimum wage). The £14,966 can then be combined with the income of a direct family member to reach the £18,600. After entry to the UK, the alien spouse has 6 months to find a job where the couple can reach £18,600 per year. This allows the government limit to stay in place while having a much fairer system.

attributes.action: 'None of the above' as option on ballot paper
attributes.background:
Party Politics can often be seen as a 'Least worst option'.
If we had the option on the ballot paper to indicate 'none of the above' then this positive act would be reflected in the turnout .
attributes.additional_details: The strength of a democracy is measured, in part, by the turnout at elections. This option would increase the intelligence as to what the electorate view of politicians really looks like. As opposed to voting for 'the least worst option'.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people convicted of murder.
attributes.background: People convicted of murder should face the death penalty.

attributes.action: Stop avoidable deaths: additional regulation of Diamorphine and other opiates
attributes.background:
Diamorphine should only be used for extreme pain in terminal illness. 
My husband was prescribed Diamorphine for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease and pneumonia from which he was recovering. This is wrongful prescribing and can cause death. Stricter legislation and rules are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Much stricter control on the prescribing of Diamorphine and all other opiates is needed. At least three doctors should authorise any prescription of these drugs, following open discussions with the patients and family. The wishes of the patient must be the central focus. Special training needs to be given in the prescription of opiates to doctors and pharmacists. Legislation needs to be introduced to enforce the above. Patients' safety must prevail.

attributes.action: Bring in free bus pass concessions at age 60 in England.
attributes.background:
Free bus travel is available to people from aged 60 in Scotland, Wales and Northern ireland
The date at which you can apply for a bus pass in England is state pensionable age (currently 2023) if you are now age 60. This is geographical discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: A Senior Railcard is available to anyone aged 60 or over. There should be no distinction in age for a concession on bus or rail transport, or where you live in the UK. All transport concessions should be from age 60 regardless of where you live in the UK.

attributes.action: Everyone must wear a helmet whilst riding their push bike or scooter by law
attributes.background:
It’s not acceptable that kids or adults ride their bikes or scooters without wearing helmets to protect them. 
If we can ride on roads we must be equipped to deal with road hazards
attributes.additional_details: Australia, New Zealand and America have laws that mean it is illegal to ride your bike of scooter without a helmet. The cost to the NHS if you sustain a brain injury as a result of not wearing a helmet is massive far more than the price of a helmet.

attributes.action: Children to wear helmets when using a scooter
attributes.background: We need to protect our children heads when scooting. Pavements have uneven surfaces, so as not to single out any children,it should be law that all children should be made to wear helmets.It seems bizarre that there is not a law in place currently to protect our children from head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: Nearly every child has a scooter and they ride extremely fast,often with both feet on the scooter. We need to protect our children's heads. Pavements are notorious for trip hazards-tree roots, drain covers, cracked paving and when scooting at the speed they do, they don't have time to react or brake to prevent the scooter tipping and risking a head injury.  Bones and scrapes heal but a head injury is extremely dangerous and could be easily prevented by protecting the head using a helmet.

attributes.action: Tougher fines for Drivers that park in DISABLED SPACES
attributes.background: Disabled spaces are there for people that need them some of the most disabled and vulnerable people in our community, People get fined the same amount for parking in a space and over staying there paid parking ticket they have bought from a machine.
attributes.additional_details: People who park in a disabled space without a blue badge show total disregard for the people who need them the most, the punishment should be harsher why should they pay the same as someone over staying there paid ticket?

attributes.action: Make dementia training mandatory within the NHS and hospitals.
attributes.background: Help me change how people living with dementia can have a better quality of care when visiting the hospital and being treated by staff with very little or no experience and  knowledge of the disease and also help the staff to better their knowledge and understanding of dementia.
attributes.additional_details: Elderly lady living with dementia in a care home setting had a fall as was taken to A & E due to NHS staff ( GP's, OT's, Radiographers and nurses ) lack of understanding and knowledge of dementia. She was sedated unnecessarily as they said she was a risk to herself.

attributes.action: Recall of MPs Act to include failure of MPs to abide by Constituents’ wishes
attributes.background: The Recall of MPs Act 2015 is very limited in scope. It only covers when an MPs is sentenced to a prison term or is suspended from the House for at least 21 sitting days.  It should be extended to allow for the recall of MPs that ignore the wishes of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.additional_details: A third reason for the Recall of an MP should include acting contrary to their Election Manifesto, by for example voting against something they promised, and acting contrary to the wishes of the majority of their constituents as expressed in a national or local referendum.

attributes.action: Ban quad bikes in residential areas
attributes.background: Loud and aggressively speeding quadbikes are everywhere in residential areas morning evening nights. They so loud that my 4 months old son is terrified of them. It’s very normal to see a quadbike speeding 40-50 mph in 20-30 mph zone.
attributes.additional_details:
These quadbike riders do not have any respect for speed limits. 
No respect if someone is ill at home needs rest. 
So loud that little babies waking up screaming. 
And above all safety of our kids on the roads just outside your home.

attributes.action: We call on the Government to abandon the HS2 Rail project.
attributes.background: With the projected cost of HS2 rising towards £100bn, it would be better to stop the project now and use the money saved to provide free solar panels to the whole of the country.
attributes.additional_details: The former Chairman of Eurostar, Adam Mills, wrote that the claimed social and economic benefits of HS@ were "away with the fairies". He added, it would be far wiser to spend the money on traditional  rail enhancements given the relatively short distances between UK cities. In economic terms HS@ is unjustifiable. Existing trains  between London and Birmingham are underused at present and saving business men 30 minutes of travelling time does not justify the destruction of 1740 buildings including 888 homes, together with 60 irreplaceable ancient woodlands being destroyed.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure packaging materials of all items are clearly identified.
attributes.background: The UK has various systems of recycling with geographical differences in what is recycled. This is made more difficult as it's not always obvious what an item or packaging is made from. This is particularly important re plastic as some types are recyclable and others not. Clear labelling may assist.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been doing my best for a while now to try and reduce my impact, including reusing and then recycling items to reduce the amount going to landfill. A lot of people do the same and some councils are very good at encouraging this. However I hear a lot of people saying that it is too complicated to recycle as they don't know what goes in which bin, etc. 

If we were to have a standardised system of labelling, with all packaging showing what it is made from it would assist people greatly.

attributes.action: Include teaching ‘self examination’ in health/sex education in schools.
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with breast cancer ive learnt that early detection really does save lives.How many truly check and know their bodies?In school we are taught sex ed/hygiene. Teaching to routinely self examine the correct way in this lesson would bring body awareness and in turn early detection
attributes.additional_details: My intention with this petition is that if self examination is introduced to the health/sex Education curriculum then self checking would become part of our daily lives and routines like washing/cleaning teeth/wearing deodorant. ..whilst in the shower we check ourselves. Right now we don’t all do it because we weren’t taught too from a young age and it’s not routine. This needs to change and be taught in schools, early detection does save lives it is so important to know your body!

attributes.action: Make a paid counsellor available for all students in every secondary school
attributes.background: Adolescents aged 11-19 attend secondary school. Ages that bring their own personal, intimate difficulties and ups & downs. They are finding it harder mental health problems. There are many more school nurses on site than counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Figures suggest 20% of adolescents may experience a mental health problem in any given year, that 50% of mental health problems are established by age 14 with 75% established by age 24. In 2004 10% of children and young people aged 5-16 years had a clinically diagnosable mental health problem; yet in 2008 one study suggested 70% of children & adolescents who experienced mental health problems had not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. It is thought 13% of adolescents try to self harm between ages 11-16. Figures in 2014 suggested a 70% increase in A&E admissions for self-harm over the previous two years.

attributes.action: Ban pet shops from selling tortoises
attributes.background: Pet shops do not know how to provide the right care for these reptiles and keep them in the wrong conditions also some are too young to be sold and some are sold when they are ill and die later on.
attributes.additional_details: I bought a tortoise from the local pet shop it was way to young to be sold a little time later it died. I'm not happy with the conditions these poor animals are kept in and I would like it stopped. I would not like any other person or the poor reptiles to experience this.

attributes.action: Make £2.00 the most any catering company/school/borough can charge for hot food
attributes.background: I would like the UK government to introduce a maximum that any school ,catering company or borough can charge students to eat the hot food or main meal that the school serves.
attributes.additional_details: The price of hot food in schools across the UK has increased by an average of 5% over the past 4 years.The unjust increase means that some children have to buy food from shops, which would be harmless if  the food that children were buying was healthy but that isn't the case unfortunately in most situations snacks like crisps sweets and biscuits are less healthy than an actual meal but are a lot less expensive.Adults have pay to much for school food.

attributes.action: Prevent government from including gagging clauses in contracts with charities.
attributes.background: The government has reportedly included clauses in their contracts with NGOs, charities and businesses, barring the organisations in question from creating 'adverse publicity'. This prevents organisations speaking up for the people they are trying to help. Sign the petition to have this debated.
attributes.additional_details:
This type of gagging clause has been reported to have been used with Brexit consultants, Grenfell Tower investigators and charities working with Universal Credit claimants, amongst others. 
 
The government is systematically silencing dissent, putting self interest above the welfare of its citizens. This, ultimately, represents a threat to democracy.
 
Sign the petition so this can be discussed in Parliament.

attributes.action: NHS screening for Lung cancer for people aged 55 and over.
attributes.background: My mother was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic lung cancer in September 2018. Before her diagnosis she had no symptoms and was healthy. She died on October 6th 2018 after a short battle with the disease. She didn’t display Any symptoms until the cancer had speedy to her kidneys, liver and spine.
attributes.additional_details: Lung cancer is one of the biggest killers in the world. Never usually displaying symptoms untill it is too late. Regular 3-5 yearly screening in people who smoke or have a history of smoking or for people who have family history of Lung cancer or other health problems that higher the risk will hopefully lower the mortality rate and give people who develop this disease a fighting chance when it is at a stage where successfully treated.

attributes.action: Allow European Nationals to vote in UK general elections
attributes.background:
European Nationals are contributing in  all parts of the British society and are currently  not allowed to vote in general elections ,when citizens of the commonwealth are allowed , help us end this unfair practice.
Give them a voice, give them a chance to vote
attributes.additional_details:
European Nationals are your neighbours, your friends, your husbands and wives, many have settled in the UK and are making a real contribution to your daily lives, they serve you in your local cafe, they are your doctors and Nurses .
They love the UK and pay their taxes here, but are currently not allowed to vote in the general elections, we want to ask the UK government to end this unfair practice and allow them to vote in the general elections.

attributes.action: Stop the plans to add folic acid to flour because of allergies
attributes.background: News that folic acid is to be added to flour could be bad news for the future health of children. Folic acid during pregnancy has been linked to food allergies in later childhood. Increased allergies increase the burden on NHS. Some allergies are potentially fatal.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent medical research https://www.medpagetoday.com/meetingcoverage/aaaai/71566
 
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5949539/
 
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/POST-PN-467/POST-PN-467.pdf
 
Increasing allergies 
https://www.allergyuk.org/information-and-advice/statistics
 
Increasing food allergies in children and death 
https://amp.theguardian.com/society/2018/oct/01/why-are-food-allergies-in-children-on-the-rise-and-is-there-anything-parents-can-do-to-protect-them

attributes.action: Remove Arriva of their contract for disruptions to people and the economy
attributes.background:
Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%

We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards.

attributes.action: Stop Councils charging disabled people for the cost of care and support at home
attributes.background: I am 23 years old. I have profound Learning Difficulties with complex health needs. Currently, I live at home with my mum and dad who provide a roof over my head, saving the government a huge amount of money.
attributes.additional_details: The councils are using the term Fairer Contribution Financial Assessment for Social Care to charge disabled people extra money to balance their books. This is an indirect cut to my benefits as well as to my care package. The main principles of the Care Act are well- being, these charges are going to impact on health.

attributes.action: Better health care and awareness for young people with respiratory conditions.
attributes.background: As a young person who suffers from severe Asthma, I've only recently started getting the medical treatment i needed after a lifetime of suffering from the condition (17 years). Unfortunately this is the same for many young people and this is something i would like to change.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, GP's are not educated enough about the severity of asthma and other respiratory conditions such as COPD. Hospital treatments are only temporary such as nebulisers and steroid medication and after this, GP's do not provide the sufficient checks to make sure an "attack" does not happen again. Asthma UK and COPD both do fundraising to raise awareness of the severity of both conditions and I feel like the government and the public could do more to help.

attributes.action: Stop MTC Multiplication Tables Check as a statutory test for year 4 students
attributes.background: The department of education are making testing compulsory from academic year 2018/2019 for year 4 students in the UK. These are timed tests that test all times tables up to 12x12 and are already causing unnecessary anxiety to 7 and 8 year olds in preparation for these tests.
attributes.additional_details: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/755745/2018_MTC_assessment_framework_PDFA.pdf

attributes.action: Register stillbirths from 16 weeks pregnancy
attributes.background: I believe that all babies that are physically born should not be called miscarriages. It is detrimental to the health of the mother who has to go into labour physically push their child out of their body.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently gave birth to a little boy at 19 weeks, almost half way full term pregnancy. Baby was fully formed but not fully grown, but the hardest thing that I have had to deal with is that I have been described as having had a miscarriage. 
My body did NOT reject and dispel a foetus for natural reasons , ie miscarry, which is why I believe all ladies who have to give birth should be recognised as having had a stillbirth and not a miscarriage. All we want is acknowledgement.

attributes.action: Have a referendum to devolve Yorkshire into a country.
attributes.background: As a student in the heart of Yorkshire, I believe it is the fundamental right for citizens of Yorkshire to have greater power over their society, economy and environment.
attributes.additional_details: This is why I am proposing to start a referendum to decide whether the people of Yorkshire want to be independent from England but remain in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Create a demo version of a Universal Credit online account.
attributes.background: To ask the DWP to create a demo version of a Universal Credit online account. With which claimants can familiarise themselves with the online software. Helping to prevent digital exclusion.

attributes.action:
Introduce laws to prevent insult to 
religions and religious personalities.
attributes.background: The world is seeing a rise in disturbing trends of extremism in society that seek to create a fear, suspicion and hate towards Muslims masked under the guise of freedom of expression, nationalism and patriotism.
attributes.additional_details: Early 20th century anti-Semitic propaganda of the Nazis sought to control the news and information to the people that ultimately resulted in the expulsion and mass murder of millions of Jews in Europe. In the current climate powerful groups of people and individuals have been emboldened by a belief that it is their right to offend, ridicule and target an entire faith community (Islam and Muslims), by creating a climate of fear and suspicion under the guise of freedom of speech and expression.

attributes.action: Please tell Theresa May to withdraw her invitation to tyrant Prayuth Chan-Ocha
attributes.background:
Theresa May has invited Thai dictator Prayuth to the UK on June 20 and hopes to agree new arms deals.
We are UK-based Thais who want democracy and human rights. Please support our message to May: 
Don’t welcome Prayuth to Britain. Tell him to restore Thai democracy. Don’t sell arms to the junta.
attributes.additional_details:
Prayuth seized power in an illegal coup in 2014, overthrowing elected leader Yingluck Shinawatra. The junta has used dictatorial power to repress human rights, prosecute critics of military rule, ban political activity, censor media, and try dissidents in unfair military courts. 

Prayuth was also army chief in 2010 when the military launched a violent crackdown on pro-democracy protesters. More than 90 people were killed and nearly 2,000 wounded.

attributes.action: National Government to decide planning applications for land sold by councils
attributes.background: Local councils hold and own lots of land. If they choose to sell this land it is in the councils best interests to pass any planning application applied for on the land. Once the planning application is approved the council will benefit from the sale. There is a conflict of interest that must cease.
attributes.additional_details: Stafford Borough Council (SBC) are selling a large piece of land at Tilling Drive in Stone Staffs for a lot of money, subject to planning permission. It is therefore in SBC's interest to approve planning consent on this land. It is wrong for a council selling land to also give permission to develop the land. I believe a conflict of interest exists. In such circumstances a government body should manage any planning application to ensure true open and honest government. All ambiguities should be removed from the process and due diligence applied.
